content:
One big issue new folks have with zulip is confusion with interleaved views. What would folks think of the following change:

  • Clicking on a stream name shows only the first topic.
  • You have to click a second time (or use the s shortcut) to see the full stream view

I think the main cost for experienced users is that when catching up on streams you don't care about, often you do want the stream-level interleaved view, so that you can hit End if nothing else. Also the double-click thing will be pretty hard to discover.

(Note: If we do do such a change, I think we would absolutely want to try it on chat.zulip.org for a few days first :).)

So I'm definitely biased here by the way my brain works, but I've never been a big fan of the interleaved view. So I support a more topic-centric approach in Zulip. I'm 100% in favor of having clicking on a stream name show the first topic, which I assume you mean is the first one in the sidebar, aka the most recent topic. In order to widen, I think we want to think about making a more obvious mechanism than the s shortcut to do it. You can click on the recipient bar, of course, but that's not totally obvious either.
One brainstorm is to do something more obvious in the left sidebar when you're narrowed to a topic, so that the current stream has an obvious call-to-action for widening.

interesting. Maybe have the stream name look something like
[# design see all ]
after you click # design the first time. (With the "see all" in tiny font.)
My temptation here would be to just build something that does first-topic-by-default and then see what we need after trying it. I don't think it would take that much work to prototype.

==Tim

And I've come around to preferring a topic-centric approach -- as a longtime Zephyr/BarnOwl user I used to be for interleaved views all the time, but I've found n and a topic-centric approach very handy in keeping up with this realm over the past N months.
To the point where when going to a stream, I almost always want to look at one topic at a time.
Yeah, I agree with @Tim Abbott on doing a simple thing first and iterating. So treat my sidebars suggestion as just a half-baked brainstorm and nothing more than that. :smile:
I merged this. @Rohitt Vashishtha It looked complete by the time I got to it, and I tested it out. I guess a nice followup would be to get some node coverage.
